definition: to pick/to choose/to fight a duel
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up

sentences.english: I really want ot see him posting up or taking defenders one on one.
sentences.chinese: 我很想看他卡主位置以後和防守隊員單挑。
爲什麼單挑華爲的刺呢？

sentences.english: You, mini-man. Takin' on the jellies.
sentences.chinese: 你呀，迷你魚，單挑那些水母。

sentences.english: Beno : You haven't any duel with your guild member?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有和你的公會會員單挑過？

sentences.english: Do you think US alone can take China?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲美國就可以單挑中國？

sentences.english: But you don't want her going up against 14 Battlecruisers.
sentences.chinese: 但你不會想用她來單挑14部巡洋艦。

sentences.english: We’ll battle on the court when I’m 39 and he’s 19.
sentences.chinese: 等到我39歲，他19歲時，我們會在場上單挑。

sentences.english: Scar face people back Chen men, and Chen singled out face to face.
sentences.chinese: 疤臉人打退陳大的手下，和陳大面對面單挑。

sentences.english: You'd be up against Sir Alex – how big an influence has he been on you?
sentences.chinese: 那你就得和爵爺單挑了，他對你有多大影響？

definition: to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
member of same class, team, work group etc/teammate
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
